customer_reviews.title: Awesome for DJI X5
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my DJI X5 camera. It's not an officially supported lens, but it does work. The X5/Osmo itself does reject it from time-to-time, but that problem is easily resolved with a restart. The lens itself creates a beautiful image for 4K video, and is the longest lens you get can onto an X5 by a longshot. I'm thrilled I picked one up!

customer_reviews.text: This lens brings my Sony NEX-6 to Nikon DSRL level. I can finally leave my Nikon D600 at home for light travel and not feel guilty. The 60mm Sigma is razor sharp wide open and the bokeh is as smooth as my best Nikon primes. I suspect the 30mm f2.8 may be up for sale soon. the autofocus is not zippy but I already knew that going in. Well done Sigma!
customer_reviews.author: MrVag

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This lens is great. Well worth the price for sharp pictures.
customer_reviews.author: james melton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality pictures
customer_reviews.text: I never thought one day I 'll get a great lens like this in this price, I recently bought a new camera specifically for this lens ;-)
customer_reviews.author: AlQusimi

customer_reviews.title: Believe The Hype
customer_reviews.text: Got it today and already in love with this lens. The focus ring is extremely sensitive and accurate and a joy to use. Amazingly sharp. Coming from the pany 14mm pancake I can definitely see the difference between the 2.8 (sigma) vs. 2.5 for the pany, but it is what it is and what it is is amazing. Will be taking it out tomorrow for shooting around the city. Outstanding lens at a giveaway price. You won't be disappointed.

customer_reviews.title: Performs well, fits my Sony alpha a-6000, makes ...
customer_reviews.text: Performs well, fits my Sony alpha a-6000, makes some rattling when moved, focus is a little slow, but overall it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel E.

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp lens but maybe better for portrait shots
customer_reviews.text: The lens is very sharp in the center even wide open; however, I often found myself in a awkward distance to shoot, and I shoot landscape and city skylines a lot so the lens of the lens is somewhat limited.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Wang

customer_reviews.title: An expression of good taste
customer_reviews.text: This lens is elegant and well crafted. In addition, the combination of focal length and max aperture creates a delightful user experience. It is light and produces beautiful images. A very interesting lens, well suited for those with a refined taste for photography.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Heck of a lens for Olympus Pen
customer_reviews.text: Using it on my Olympus Pen without any issues. Great value for the price; very sharp lens and focuses quickly and smooth. Fantastic build quality. With the micro 4/3 sensor size it is a longer focal length. Great for portraits.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: The lens is long prime, effectively 90mm on a full-size sensor. It's fast and sharp. Do not, however, think of it as a zoom lens. The factory hood is of little use. It fit loose and didn't shield the lens from flaring. I bought an accessory hood and ring adapter.The colors are true, no noticeable aberrations or distortions. I am very pleased with sharp focus/blurred backgrounds and long landscape shots. I think it would be a very good portrait lens.
customer_reviews.author: Catenaccio

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lens that takes clear pictures
customer_reviews.text: Very nice lens that takes clear pictures. Have used primarily for landscapes and am able to get very good DOF.

customer_reviews.title: Great budget portaitcor short telephoto lens.
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed the Sony e version in YouTube. And it was excellent. This lens on micro four thirds is equally as good but at f2.8 the dof isn't as shallow as I would like it to be but the price also reflects that.

customer_reviews.text: Used lens ordered. The lens that arrived was Sony E-mount, not Micro 4/3 as advertised. Fortunately I have a NEX that can use this. Nice lens anyway.
